704473f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Elizabeth Place
704473f-a.text:
26 Fulton Street, at the S.W. corner of Elizabeth Place, showing the building in which Hans Bergen carried on a bakery from 1717 to about 1730, in conjunction with a store, and a stable for horses of the residents of the Island when crossing to New York. The stable was a stone building, located, as near as can be ascertained, on the westerly corner of Fulton and Elizabeth Streets. A prtion of the walls of which are supposed to form the easterly end of the building located there. In 1840, it was N. Guerneys' Mechanic 's 1
Hotel.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704473f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Elizabeth Place, Brooklyn, NY

704477f-c.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Elizabeth Place
704477f-c.text:
(1)
Fulton Street, at the N.W. corner of Elinabeth Place, showing, what
in 1840 was, N. Guernsey's Mechanics Hall.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster dellecyion.
(2)
The same, another view.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, showing Elisabeth Place and the Fulton Street Elevated
Lines of the B.M.T. on Fulton Street.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Arwbruster Collestion.
